<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/04/trumps-covid19-diagnosis-kicks-off-prominent-contact-tracing-effort?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
President of the United Trace
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="President Trump announces his Supreme Court nominee in a crowded Rose Garden ceremony" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNjM1L3Jvc2VfZ2FyZGVuLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On a normal day, the president can't sneeze without generating breaking news alerts. Now that he's hospitalized with Covid-19, Trump's every handshake and passing "hello" from the last two weeks is facing intense scrutiny in the most prominent case of contact tracing to date.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">How it works: </strong></span><span>Contact tracers make a list of everyone an infected person came in contact with. Then, they find those people and tell them to self-isolate before infecting others. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A few gatherings stand out </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Trump attended <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/latest-updates-trump-covid-19-results/2020/10/03/919732233/how-do-you-contact-trace-the-president-of-the-united-states?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">at least 10 events</a> while he may have been infectious, including a nomination ceremony for his Supreme Court pick. As you can see above, there weren't a lot of masks or distancing, and at least seven attendees later tested positive, including the first lady and Utah Sen. Mike Lee. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These events have also disrupted private sector operations working close to the administration. A trio of White House journalists recently tested positive, and ABC News is <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/03/media/abc-quarantine-chris-christie/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quarantining staff</a> who came in contact with Christie during a post-debate broadcast. The president of the University of Notre Dame, one of 18 faculty who attended the nomination, <a href="https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/ct-university-of-notre-dame-president-covid-19-20201002-543hkpjc65ekvl3jteqgcbgqou-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tested positive</a> Saturday. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Is that what happens when we get sick? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Don't expect the national news cycle treatment, but 21% of Americans now have access to contact tracing tools. Last week, New York and New Jersey became the ninth and tenth states to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/03/covid-app-exposure-notification-apple-google.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">release tracing apps</a>, and seven more plus D.C. have apps in testing or development. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>States are using a protocol </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/04/15/apple-google-share-additional-contact-tracing-details?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">co-developed by Apple and Google</a></span><span> that uses Bluetooth technology to sense close contact to other app users for an extended period of time. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unlike many foreign governments, the U.S. left contact tracing to individual states, igniting concerns about fragmented tracing that doesn't account for movement across state lines. New York and several surrounding states have become the first to make their apps talk to each other. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Will it work?</strong> Researchers think an installation rate of just 15% of a population could help suppress the virus's spread. Virginia's app, which has been out the longest, has 11%. States are still fighting an uphill battle to convince the public these apps won't violate their privacy.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/04/president-trump-receives-experimental-drugs-treat-covid19?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Inside Trump’s Medicine Cabinet
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Trump in a motorcade" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNjM2L3RydW1wX2luX2FfbW90b3JjYWRlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>ALEX EDELMAN/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The president of the United States is in the hospital with the coronavirus. How is he being treated?  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Remdesivir: </strong>The president received his first dose of remdesivir on Friday as part of a five-day course. Remdesivir might be a familiar name—it's made by Gilead Sciences and was <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/12/gilead-drug-shows-promise?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">widely discussed</a> back in the spring, during the first wave of this health crisis.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It hasn't received full FDA approval (just emergency use authorization). However, it has been shown in clinical trials to help hospitalized Covid patients. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Antibody cocktail: </strong>Last Friday, the president's doctor Sean Conley said Trump received an experimental antibody cocktail from drugmaker Regeneron (whose <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/regeneron-stock-higher-after-news-its-covid-19-trial-drug-given-to-trump-2020-10-02?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stock rose</a> after hours following the disclosure). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Dexamethasone:</strong> Yesterday, Conley said that the president was given a dose of the steroid dexamethasone, which has been shown to help Covid-19 patients with more severe cases. Trump also received supplemental oxygen Friday, the medical team disclosed.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Trump’s doctors said the president, who made a surprise motorcade appearance last night, could be discharged from the hospital as early as Monday. However, their credibility has been diminished following a series of <a href="https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-donald-trump-international-news-politics-ap-top-news-cac560ef169f9e5343d98a128573194a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">misleading statements</a> made to the public this weekend around the president's health.</p>

QUOTES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/04/top-quotes-weekend?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Weekend Soundbites
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Cam Newton" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNjM0L2NhbV9uZXd0b24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Adam Glanzman/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">"Act fearlessly but with common sense."</strong>—British PM Boris Johnson <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-54407656?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the people of the UK</a> things will likely be "bumpy" through Christmas and beyond. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">"GET IT DONE."</strong>—President Trump, tweeting from Walter Reed, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/03/coronavirus-stimulus-update-trump-urges-congress-to-pass-relief-bill.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> the U.S. "WANTS & NEEDS" stimulus measures to keep the recovery going. Both parties have signaled progress, but there's no concrete deal on the table yet.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">"The fragility of world systems in the face of the pandemic has demonstrated that not everything can be resolved by market freedom."</strong>—Pope Francis called for economic reforms post-Covid in a <a href="https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-pope-francis-archive-capitalism-bcde0053314e65612add0709fada5519?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new encyclical</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">"A 'breakup' of Facebook is thus a complete nonstarter."</strong>—Facebook's lawyers penned a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-says-government-breakup-of-instagram-whatsapp-would-be-complete-nonstarter-11601803800?mod=hp_lead_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">14-page document</a> that gives a window into its defense against antitrust inquiries. The company is completely against sawing off WhatsApp and Instagram from FB.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">"I need a new quarterback."</strong>—a guy sitting next to us on the subway had to tweak his fantasy team's roster after learning Patriots QB Cam Newton tested positive for the coronavirus. The Patriots-Chiefs game was <a href="https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-nfl-new-england-patriots-football-cam-newton-3f99f2373eaab39d99fb0c8deb86653b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">postponed</a> to tonight.</p>

</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Movie popcorn and a face mask" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzAxL21vdmllX3BvcGNvcm5fYW5kX2FfZmFjZV9tYXNrLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">By tomorrow, major movie theater operator Cineworld could decide <a href="https://variety.com/2020/film/global/cineworld-close-us-regal-uk-cinemas-no-time-to-die-james-bond-1234791728/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">whether to indefinitely close</a> its Regal Cinemas in the U.S., as well as its theaters in the UK and Ireland.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why now? </strong>On Friday, MGM announced it's pushing the release of the newest James Bond flick, <em>No Time to Die,</em> to April 2021.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Studios have delayed most major releases because of the pandemic, and 2020 had just three blockbusters left: <em>No Time to Die, Wonder Woman 1984, </em>and <em>Dune</em>. With Bond taking an extra vacation (and theaters potentially closing), the last two could be delayed as well, leaving movie theaters with a slimmer menu than In-N-Out. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Christopher Nolan's </span><span><em>Tenet</em></span><span>, the first big test for theater attendance during the pandemic, has earned a lackluster $40+ million in the U.S. since its September release.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Having lost $1.6 billion in the first half of 2020, Cineworld has been on rocky footing for a while. If it chooses to close theaters, thousands of jobs across 543 Regal Cinemas in the U.S. and 128 cinemas in the U.K. and Ireland will be put at risk. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Start Talking
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every Monday, we curate a handful of balanced resources about a hot-button business issue and encourage you to discuss with friends, family, or coworkers. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This week's topic:</strong> Your colleague catches Covid-19—do you have a right to know? <em>Should </em>you have a right to know? Few workplaces will remain untouched by Covid-19, but disclosing that an employee tested positive can run afoul of privacy rules or norms.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Four approaches to telling employees someone got Covid-19. (</span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/25/business/dealbook/coronavirus-office-disclosure.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">DealBook</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>How do workers feel about the safety vs. privacy tradeoff? (</span><span><a href="https://www.hrdive.com/news/workers-prioritize-safety-over-privacy-contact-tracing/583873/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">HR Dive</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What employers are actually allowed (and not allowed) to do. (</span><span><a href="https://www.natlawreview.com/article/rule-5-yes-my-employer-can-do-balancing-employers-rights-and-responsibilities?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">National Law Review</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Workplace privacy can feel like it's at odds with public health. (</span><span><a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/06/26/workplace-apps-tracking-coronavirus-could-test-privacy-boundaries-340525?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Politico</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>At colleges and universities, Covid-19 reporting is largely done on a case-by-case basis, leaving a patchwork of approaches. (</span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/colleges-weigh-transparency-versus-privacy-when-it-comes-to-covid-19-data-11598347801?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ</a></span><span><span>)</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

Tuesday.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nPUBLIC HEALTH\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/04/trumps-covid19-diagnosis-kicks-off-prominent-contact-tracing-effort?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nPresident of the United Trace\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"President Trump announces his Supreme Court nominee in a crowded Rose Garden ceremony\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNjM1L3Jvc2VfZ2FyZGVuLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eChip Somodevilla/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn a normal day, the president can't sneeze without generating breaking news alerts. Now that he's hospitalized with Covid-19, Trump's every handshake and passing \"hello\" from the last two weeks is facing intense scrutiny in the most prominent case of contact tracing to date.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it works: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eContact tracers make a list of everyone an infected person came in contact with. Then, they find those people and tell them to self-isolate before infecting others. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eA few gatherings stand out \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePresident Trump attended \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/latest-updates-trump-covid-19-results/2020/10/03/919732233/how-do-you-contact-trace-the-president-of-the-united-states?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eat least 10 events\u003c/a\u003e while he may have been infectious, including a nomination ceremony for his Supreme Court pick. As you can see above, there weren't a lot of masks or distancing, and at least seven attendees later tested positive, including the first lady and Utah Sen. Mike Lee. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThese events have also disrupted private sector operations working close to the administration. A trio of White House journalists recently tested positive, and ABC News is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/03/media/abc-quarantine-chris-christie/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equarantining staff\u003c/a\u003e who came in contact with Christie during a post-debate broadcast. The president of the University of Notre Dame, one of 18 faculty who attended the nomination, \u003ca href=\"https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/ct-university-of-notre-dame-president-covid-19-20201002-543hkpjc65ekvl3jteqgcbgqou-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etested positive\u003c/a\u003e Saturday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIs that what happens when we get sick? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDon't expect the national news cycle treatment, but 21% of Americans now have access to contact tracing tools. Last week, New York and New Jersey became the ninth and tenth states to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/03/covid-app-exposure-notification-apple-google.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erelease tracing apps\u003c/a\u003e, and seven more plus D.C. have apps in testing or development. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eStates are using a protocol \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/04/15/apple-google-share-additional-contact-tracing-details?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eco-developed by Apple and Google\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that uses Bluetooth technology to sense close contact to other app users for an extended period of time. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnlike many foreign governments, the U.S. left contact tracing to individual states, igniting concerns about fragmented tracing that doesn't account for movement across state lines. New York and several surrounding states have become the first to make their apps talk to each other. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWill it work?\u003c/strong\u003e Researchers think an installation rate of just 15% of a population could help suppress the virus's spread. Virginia's app, which has been out the longest, has 11%. States are still fighting an uphill battle to convince the public these apps won't violate their privacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eALEX EDELMAN/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe president of the United States is in the hospital with the coronavirus. How is he being treated?  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRemdesivir: \u003c/strong\u003eThe president received his first dose of remdesivir on Friday as part of a five-day course. Remdesivir might be a familiar name—it's made by Gilead Sciences and was \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/12/gilead-drug-shows-promise?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewidely discussed\u003c/a\u003e back in the spring, during the first wave of this health crisis.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt hasn't received full FDA approval (just emergency use authorization). However, it has been shown in clinical trials to help hospitalized Covid patients. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAntibody cocktail: \u003c/strong\u003eLast Friday, the president's doctor Sean Conley said Trump received an experimental antibody cocktail from drugmaker Regeneron (whose \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/regeneron-stock-higher-after-news-its-covid-19-trial-drug-given-to-trump-2020-10-02?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estock rose\u003c/a\u003e after hours following the disclosure). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDexamethasone:\u003c/strong\u003e Yesterday, Conley said that the president was given a dose of the steroid dexamethasone, which has been shown to help Covid-19 patients with more severe cases. Trump also received supplemental oxygen Friday, the medical team disclosed.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eTrump’s doctors said the president, who made a surprise motorcade appearance last night, could be discharged from the hospital as early as Monday. However, their credibility has been diminished following a series of \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-donald-trump-international-news-politics-ap-top-news-cac560ef169f9e5343d98a128573194a?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emisleading statements\u003c/a\u003e made to the public this weekend around the president's health.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F10%2F04%2Fpresident-trump-receives-experimental-drugs-treat-covid19\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Both parties have signaled progress, but there's no concrete deal on the table yet.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\"The fragility of world systems in the face of the pandemic has demonstrated that not everything can be resolved by market freedom.\"\u003c/strong\u003e—Pope Francis called for economic reforms post-Covid in a \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-pope-francis-archive-capitalism-bcde0053314e65612add0709fada5519?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew encyclical\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\"A 'breakup' of Facebook is thus a complete nonstarter.\"\u003c/strong\u003e—Facebook's lawyers penned a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-says-government-breakup-of-instagram-whatsapp-would-be-complete-nonstarter-11601803800?mod=hp_lead_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e14-page document\u003c/a\u003e that gives a window into its defense against antitrust inquiries. The company is completely against sawing off WhatsApp and Instagram from FB.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\"I need a new quarterback.\"\u003c/strong\u003e—a guy sitting next to us on the subway had to tweak his fantasy team's roster after learning Patriots QB Cam Newton tested positive for the coronavirus. target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epostponed\u003c/a\u003e to tonight.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStudios have delayed most major releases because of the pandemic, and 2020 had just three blockbusters left: \u003cem\u003eNo Time to Die, Wonder Woman 1984, \u003c/em\u003eand \u003cem\u003eDune\u003c/em\u003e. With Bond taking an extra vacation (and theaters potentially closing), the last two could be delayed as well, leaving movie theaters with a slimmer menu than In-N-Out. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eChristopher Nolan's \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eTenet\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, the first big test for theater attendance during the pandemic, has earned a lackluster $40+ million in the U.S. since its September release.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Having lost $1.6 billion in the first half of 2020, Cineworld has been on rocky footing for a while. If it chooses to close theaters, thousands of jobs across 543 Regal Cinemas in the U.S. and 128 cinemas in the U.K. and Ireland will be put at risk. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
